resources.string: On touch of the start button, Net Monitor starts a passive service which detects all active network connections. A background notification will inform you of the ongoing monitoring.
Net Monitor service has been started in passive mode.
Net Monitor service has been stopped. Was in passive mode.
This app belongs to the group of Privacy Friendly Apps developed by Technische Universität Darmstadt. Sourcecode licensed under GPLv3. Images copyright TU Darmstadt und Google Inc.
More information can be found on:
This app uses Java-SSLLabs-API by Björn Roland and Qualis SSL Labs.
What is Privacy Friendly Net Monitor?

Privacy Friendly Net Monitor monitors network traffic produced by installed apps on the device. It scans active network connections with a background service and displays them with additional network encryption information.

Net Monitor deploys an background service which scans for active connections every second. The apps invoking a detected connections are identified and listed with icon and remote addresses they are communicating with. The connection overview can be refreshed by swiping down on the display or touching the refresh button in the toolbar.

Based on a connection\'s remote port, the transport protocol can be identified by "Well Known Port" tables. Based on the known ports, a warning is given if a connection is known for not being encrypted. Note that this is no grantee that the connection uses this protocol, since assignment of port numbers is not enforced by the system.

The remote host name assigned is requested by reverse name resolution. This is done asynchronously in background and may take some seconds. The resolved hostname may not be the actual domain name requested by e.g. a browser app.
A detailed mode can be toggled in the settings. When activated, additional technical information of scanned connections is displayed when a connection is touched in the overview.

An automatic analysis of the remote servers TLS implementation can be activated in the settings. When active, remote servers with a resolved hostname are tested automatically when the connection protocol is known for having TLS encryption. The analysis is performed by SSL Labs API and the associated service. The remote server\'s implementation quality is shown in grades A+ (best) to F (worst), or is displayed as T (trust issues). For further information on SSL Lab API see the about.

Privacy Friendly Net Monitor does not include any tracking mechanisms or advertisement and comes free of charge. Privacy Friendly Net Monitor is published under GPLv3 license and is free to distribute or extend.

Privacy Friendly Net Monitor does not require any permission for scanning active connections. The Certificate Validation feature requires android.permissions.INTERNET to request server test results from Qualys SSL Labs.
Show info tab when touching a connection
Perform analysis with SSL Labs API
Privacy Friendly Net Monitor observes network activity of installed apps. Use it to check on all your device\'s connections.
Currently active connections and encryption info is listed by app. \n Logging, detailed technical info, and server validation features can be activated in settings.
The sourcecode of this app is available at GitHub. For further explanations have a look at the Privacy Friendly App Guide.
